contribute.translation[0].definitions[0]: to give money, help, ideas etc to something that a lot of other people are also involved in
City employees cannot contribute to political campaigns.
The volunteers contribute their own time to the project.
contribute.translation[0].definitions[1]: to help to make something happen
Stress is a contributing factor in many illnesses.
His work contributed substantially to our knowledge of the disease and how to treat it.
Alcohol contributes to 100,000 deaths a year in the US.
contribute.translation[0].definitions[2]: to write articles, stories, poems etc for a newspaper or magazine
one of several authors contributing to the book
contribute.translation[0].note_box[0].it: Someone or something contributes to something
Will you contribute to his leaving gift?
Everyone contributed to the success of the project
contribute.translation[1].definitions[0]: to give money, help, ideas etc to something that a lot of other people are involved in
His department contributed Â£2.3 million towards the fund.
They contributed to a number of worthy causes.
